Welcome to Rest API’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, user: User, db: Session) → Contact¶

Creates a new contact for a specific user with data entered by this user.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactModel) – The data for the contact to create.

  • user (User) – The user to create contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

a created contact.

Return type:

Contact

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

Retrieves a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to receive.

  • user (User) – The user to get contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

a requested contact or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

async src.repository.contacts.read_birthdays(db: Session, user: User, days: int) → List[Contact] | None¶

Searches for users whose birthdays are within the next days specified by the user.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • user (User) – The user to search contacts for.

  • days (int) – Number of days to search for birthdays.

Returns:

List of searched contacts or None if they do not found.

Return type:

List[Contact] | None

async src.repository.contacts.read_contacts(skip: int, limit: int, user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

Retrieves a list of contacts for a specific user with specified pagination parameters.

Parameters:

  • skip (int) – The number of contacts to skip.

  • limit (int) – The maximum number of contacts to return.

  • user (User) – The user to retrieve contacts for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A list of contacts.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async src.repository.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

Removes a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to remove.

  • user (User) – The user to remove contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

Removed contact or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

async src.repository.contacts.search_contacts(user: User, db: Session, name: str | None, surname: str | None, email: str | None) → List[Contact] | None¶

Searches for contacts for specified users based on the specified parameters.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user to search contacts for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

  • name (Optional[str]) – The name of the searched contact(s).

  • surname (Optional[str]) – The surname of the searched contact(s).

  • email (Optional[str]) – The email of the searched contact.

Returns:

List of searched contacts or None if they do not found.

Return type:

List[Contact] | None

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactUpdate, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

Updates a single contact with the specified ID for a specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – The ID of the contact to update.

  • body (ContactUpdate) – The data for the contact to update.

  • user (User) – The user to update contact for.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

an updated contact or None if it does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

Confirms the user’s account creation by email.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – Email by which the user will be searched.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

Nothing.

Return type:

None

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User¶

Creates a user with specified body parameters.

Parameters:

  • body (UserModel) – The data to create user.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A user.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User¶

Retrieves a user by specified email.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – The email to search by.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

A user.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email: str, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

Updates user’s avatar.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – Email by which the user will be searched.

  • url (str) – Avatar image url.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

a User with new profile image.

Return type:

User

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

Updates refresh token for specified user.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – The user whose refresh token is being updated.

  • token (Optional[str]) – Token to be updated.

  • db (Session) – The database session.

Returns:

Nothing.

Return type:

None
